That's Right BRIAN, the vigilante marks his victims with a wound shaped lake a BAT.  An obvious reference to the occult.

They show victims with MARKS ON THEIR FACES. BRUCE looks at his father's SIGNET RING and picks somethi (a piece of flesh?) out of it with the SEWING NEEDLE. The TV shows a scared MUGGER in Gotham Prison's Hospital.
I make a few MISTAKES and I get THIS? I get MARKED! People won't even TALK to me! I been MARKED by the BAT!
But you know, JANE, not everyone thinks the vigilante is the bad guy here. A lot of Gotham's common citizens are happy to see those people get what they deserve.
Thanks for that report, BRIAN. Up next, THE BAT-MAN Vigilante: Friend or Foe?
Yes Father. Now I see. Thank you. Your loving son, Bruce.
BRUCE looks over at the pile of supplies left over from h shopping spree. BRUCE SMILES WIDE. He's missing all his front teeth.
Mayor NOONE storms into LOEB's office. He's pissed.

Loeb, what the hell is going on here? Police officers beaten in the precinct parking garage? This is an officer who has come to me with serious accusations against this department. How do you think that looks?
Mayor, sit down. (Mayor sits) You should leave this to me. Frank.
But Gillian, our operations. He knows too much, and he isn't backing off. Maybe we should slow things down.  If he goes to the press...
(interrupts) And maybe you need to remember who's running this show.  I'll say when we slow things down, which will be NEVER, AND how we handle Gordon.
He was at my office again. Said he's making a file documenting what he knows. I tried to get it but he wouldn't hand it over. He's a loose cannon. There's no telling what he might do.
Don't you worry, Frank. I'm putting Gordon where he can't do any harm.
LOEB smiles.
BRUCE cuts a HOCKEY MASK in half and spray-paints it blac along with the AMMO BELT, the GROIN PROTECTOR and KNIFE. He paints a pair of STEEL DENTURES white.
November 6. Dear Father, it's all coming together. I can feel it.
BRUCE welds a familiar but primitive BAT LOGO into a pair brass knuckles. He tries them on over a pair of HEAVY LEA GLOVES with razor blades fitted into the side-seams.
I have everything I need.
BRUCE fills the ammo belt with: ROPE, DUCT TAPE, LOCK PIC SET, dangerous looking STUN GRENADES В—
All the pieces are falling into place.
В— SYRINGES labeled 'stimulant', 'pain killer', 'truth se 'fear toxin' В—
Everything is changed.  I am reborn.
В— SMOKE BOMBS, also home made and dangerous looking -
I will show them no mercy.
RECORDER, BINOCULARS, SEWING KIT, and SUPER-GLUE.
Father, you will have your revenge!
Bruce puts on the LEATHER GLOVES and - click - the AMMO B around his waist.
GORDON stands at attention before LOEB's huge, walnut des He's swollen and bruised.
You wanted to see me, sir?
Yes, Gordon.  I heard about the unfortunate incident the other day. (sarcastic) Funny, you'd think a trained police officer would have no problem with thugs in the precinct garage.
Yes, you would.
LOEB is taken back. Was that some kind of jab? He continu
I'm reassigning you.
GORDON suppresses a smile, hopeful.
The press has its panties in a bunch, asking questions, hounding me.
LOEB enjoys it, draws it out.
And because you seem to need a, umm, SAFER environment. I'm putting you on THE BAT-MAN vigilante case.
GORDON scowls. Pure rage.
GORDON pounds on an old TYPEWRITER at the kitchen table. MARLBOROS overflow an ash tray. ANN stands behind him in nightgown, hands on his shoulders.
Honey, can't this wait?
This file is my only chance. They put me on THE BAT-MAN case to get rid of me. I can't let Loeb push me aside that easily. I've got to compile the evidence Noone needs to take them down.
OK, honey. But come to bed soon.
She gives him a kiss and leaves. GORDON resumes typing.

Section fourteen: Commissioner Loeb. Based on interviews and my direct contact with the commissioner, I believe it is possible the commissioner's involvement goes far deeper than the kickback slush fund. Loeb may be CONTROLLING all organized crime in Gotham City. As of now these allegations are mere speculation, I don't have the resources to pursue that line of inquiry.
GORDON sighs, lights another MARLBORO and goes back to wo
GORDON walks down dark stairs, along a long corridor, dow more stairs, past dripping pipes, through a door, down another hallway with flickering lights, to the door to В—
On the walls hang maps with numbered pins, police sketche THE BAT-MAN and photos of the MARKS on victims' faces. As GORDON enters, a young police officer, MERKEL, jumps u
Good morning, sir. Three more came in last night sir.
Let me guess, we'll find all of them in the prison wing at Gotham Mercy.
Yup. All three, admitted last night.
We better hit the road then. I can get my coffee on the way.
GORDON leaves. MERKEL runs after him pulling on his coat.

GORDON and MERKEL meet Dr. Wallace as they pass through security. They talk as they walk through the busy ward. Everywhere beaten men lie cuffed to hospital beds. Some i traction, or horrible looking braces. Almost all bear the MARK OF THE BAT.
Morning doctor. I hear you have a few more guests for us to talk to.
Merkel. Gordon. Your lacerations seem to be healing nicely.
(ignoring the remark) So what do you have for us today'
Couple guys from an electronics store heist. Broken clavicle, some ribs, dislocated shoulder, concussion and about 12 hours surgery between 'em.
And the other one?
A pusher from Stilmore Heights. He'll need some dental work and he took about 75 stitches but he's OK. We have him in isolation if you want to talk to him.
Yeah?
Seems he was made to eat his own product. We've had to keep him away from the general population.
The doctor stops to inspect the chart for a man in bandag
(to MERKEL) Do you notice anything about these men?
You mean the mark of the bat?
No, I'm talking about their spirit. These men are broken. Scared.
MERKEL looks around. HE'S RIGHT! Some of the criminals ar even crying. Just then the doctor opens a door for the cops.
Here's your drug dealer.
In the corner of the padded room cowers the former shell once-tough street pusher. His haunted eyes are framed by stitched-up wounds that still very much resemble a bat.
Harvey DENT opens a door bearing the words, "HARVEY DENT, ASSISTANT DISTRICT ATTORNEY" for GORDON. The two men enter together. GORDON carries a note pad.
You're kidding me! I'm THE BAT-MAN vigilante? My wife will love this.
Hey, you're young, you work out. And I've seen your record. You have no love of organized crime. I saw the ESTRADA trial on TV.
Yeah, well he's still on the streets, isn't he. If I was the vigilante, ESTRADA would be making license plates right now, not running Gotham's prostitution racket.
Yeah, it must be FRUSTRATING. (flipping through notes) You know, ESTRADA's operation has been hit quite a few times. A detective was even killed at one of his brothels.
I heard. Detective CAMPBELL. No big loss for the department from what I understand.
GORDON smiles at that.
Yeah, well I have a list of dates and times. I'd like you to account for your whereabouts.

(takes the list) Sorry detective, I was in DC at a convention for three of these dates and my wife will tell you I was home with her for most of the rest. I'm not your BAT-MAN. Wish I was but I'm not.
No you don't. He's a dangerous psychopath. And when I catch him, he's going down hard.
I'm surprised to hear you say that Gordon. I hear you're one of few remaining good cops on the force.
Oh Christ, not you too. You of all people should know, we live in a society of laws. This guy isn't a hero. He thinks he's above the law. He's a terrorist. Plain and simple.
GORDON lights another MARLBORO.

SELINA and HOLLY now live in a large warehouse divided by plywood into dozens of small rooms for prostitutes. Their cubicle sports a sagging bed and a gaudy pink paint-job. ceiling is chicken wire. Hundreds of voices В— arguing, copulating, flirting В— fi cavernous space around and above their cubicle. Selina wears a blonde wig. It's dinner time, SELINA: Tuna from a can, HOLLY: Pizza.
SELINA, I don't like it here.
Hush. Keep your voice down. I'm Mistress Kitty now. You have to remember that. No one can know who we are.
I'm sorry.
Look, I don't like it any better than you, OK? But I've got an idea. We can change things В— for real this time.
What are you going to do?
I'm going to take a little something  back from those bastards. I'm going to make them pay.
Can't we just leave town, go somewhere where CHI-CHI and the cops can't find us?

Come on HOLLY. If it isn't CHI-CHI, it's going to be someone else. (moves closer to HOLLY) Now, I've been talking to some of the girls who work down on Franklin street. They say sometimes city limos pick up girls down there for parties. I figure we get a camera...
(interrupting) You're SCARING me.
Yeah, well, maybe it's TIME we did some scaring.
SELINA finishes her tuna and throws the can to a black ca

GORDON smokes a cigarette and watches a small monitor set on his desk. MERKEL stands behind him with his coat on. The security tape, CHOPPY and GRAINY, shows the inside of jewelry store. Four men climb through a broken window and begin stuffing their pockets with gems.
Watch this. He scares the crap out of them.

Suddenly they all jump in surprise. A dark SHADOWY FIGURE enters the frame. It's THE BAT-MAN we can't make out exactly what he looks like. To us he's a big, black hulk. The men back away, SCARED. THE SHADOWY FIGURE LEAPS ON TH There's a fight but it's over very quickly. The SHADOWY FIGURE leaves the thieves TWITCHING on the floor.
Jesus. The guy is BRUTAL.
Yeah. BRUTAL and VICIOUS.
Shouldn't you call it a night?
I've still got a little more work to do.
All right. Well, good night, sir.
MERKEL leaves. GORDON hits rewind.

GORDON sits in his parked car between Al and Son's Garage the CATHOUSE. CHI-CHI yells at the girls as he hobbles down the steps a gets in his car. A moment later he pulls out. GORDON stubs out his cigarette and pulls out after him. From a nearby ROOFTOP a large shadowy silhouette watches both.
GORDON bursts in unannounced.
Harvey, I need a favor
Good morning to you too, Jim.
I need a search warrant.
You don't need a warrant to search my place, Jim. You're always welcome. Come over tonight and dig through my underwear drawer for a mask and cape.
Sorry, you're not a suspect anymore, Harvey. You're just not BAT-MAN material.
My wife will be so disappointed. She's really into the suit.
Yeah, OK. I didn't need to hear that. (gets serious) It's not a BAT-MAN thing, Harvey.  I've got a hunch.
A hunch? Aren't you supposed to stick to THE BAT-MAN case?
That's what I need you for. I can't request it myself.
OK, I'm listening

After we spoke, I got to thinking about the CAMPBELL murder. He was killed INSIDE one of ESTRADA's cathouses, just before the vigilante appeared. And ESTRADA's prostitution ring has been hammered by the vigilante.
So you think ESTRADA can lead you to THE BAT-MAN?
Or the other way around. It doesn't matter.
I still don't get it.
Look, I just want to take a look inside one of ESTRADA's warehouses.  OK?
Hey. OK. You got it. I'll put the request in front of Judge Gillen this afternoon. Jim, this BAT-MAN thing is really getting to you, huh?

The guy's slippery and he's getting better. Doing bigger and bigger criminals. He's changing his M.O., using a random pattern so we can't catch him. And he's been working on his disguise. It's... TRANSFORMING.

A shadow runs across the gravel toped surface, and leaps the next roof. Seen from below as a fast, fluttering blur against a clou filled night-sky. He's going from high buildings to lower ones, jumping and rolling into the shadows. A window opens, a confused person looks out .
You see that Harold?
Betty, ferchristsake, close the window. You'll catch your death.

Betty closes the window and gets back to her life. We follow his progress but have trouble seeing him. We ca a glimpse as he LEAPS from a high building across an alle onto the fire escape on the other side. Then he's gone over the lip of the roof. This is THE BAT-MAN's environment, elevator rooms drippin with tar, the water towers, the TV antennas, ABANDONED mattresses, old chairs, cable TV hookup boxes, the crisp night air, alone.
The new identity changes everything, Father. I have an edge. I stay off the streets, work only at night. I stab fear in their hearts. I HAVE BECOME  THEIR NIGHTMARE!

Then we finally get a good look at THE BAT-MAN decked out his new threads. He's MASSIVE, TERRIFYING, SPECTACULAR. He stands on the edge of a high roof, silhouetted against giant full moon, watching an В—

Below GORDON and a bunch of UNIFORMED COPS file out of a warehouse. GORDON balls up a search warrant and throws it into the gutter, DISGUSTED. The cops drive off moments before CHI-CHI arrives in his and hobbles on crutches inside the В—

CHI-CHI makes his way through rows of stacked cardboard b and rolls of carpet. Then it's, slowly and painfully, up a flight of wooden st to an office, the kind with glass windows overlooking the warehouse and high glass skylights. In the office, five young men drape themselves over leath sofas, smoking, and throwing potato chips at a group of young, malnourished women who cower on the floor. SANCHEZ, an older, fat man, sits behind a desk on the pho
(into the phone) They just left. Yeah, they had a warrant. Bunch of pussies. I told them they're house cleaners. Hey, what can they do? The girls have papers.
Nobody greets CHI-CHI as he enters. No one offers him a s
Yeah, they look good too. No, I got the Russian ones. Oh yeah? No shit! The shipment from Honk Kong or the Mainland? Well I hope they're as good as these.
SANCHEZ hangs up.
So, CHI-CHI. Leg still hurt?
Well sometimes when it's wet out I get this...
(interrupting) No one cares. What's our take for the week?
We did OK.
CHI-CHI crutches over and puts a yellow paper bag from a department store on SANCHEZ 's desk.
(looks in the bag) OK? What the hell is OK? We don't pay you for OK. We want good. We want great. We want freaking excellent out of you!
There's been problems lately.  Business is off. This vigilante is keeping the Johns away. He's got everyone scared to...
A shower of glass drops from an overhead skylight. THE BAT-MAN lands on SANCHEZ' desk. A terrifying demon of the night. Pure menace.
Gentlemen, I'm here to ask you a few questions.

The men are stunnedВ— paralyzed by fear until SANCHEZ pul UZI from a holster and fires a volley at THE BAT-MAN. BUT HE'S GONE. The bullets strike CHI-CHI in the CHEST. HE GOES DOWN. THE BAT-MAN is in the air, he somersaults over the men on sofas. Smoke Bombs fly from his fingers. POP. POP. POP. POP. Then it's all shadows and confusion. Guns fire.  BAM.  BAM. BAM. Bones CRACK. People SCREAM. Guns - CLICK. CLICK. CLICK. - empty. Finally a body smashes through the plate glass onto the warehouse floor. A chimney effect takes place. The smoke, longer trapped, is quickly sucked out the broken skylight leaving THE BAT-MAN and SANCHEZ the lone people on two fe SANCHEZ, in shock, clicks his empty gun. The women break for the door and scatter into the night. A man clutches his throat and writhes on the desk. Without ever removing his eyes from SANCHEZ, THE BAT-MAN draws a knife and jabs it into the choking man's throat. Instant tracheotomy. The man can breathe, he slides, relieved, to the floor.
Now then, where is your boss.
THE BAT-MAN grabs SANCHEZ by the head with both hands
Where is ESTRADA?
Down... docks... new girls... shipment
THE BAT-MAN throws SANCHEZ to the floor.

A black LINCOLN CONTINENTAL drives through the bleak, bar streets of Gotham at BREAK-NECK SPEED. It is no ordinary LINCOLN CONTINENTAL В— It's the BAT-MOB Its windows are tinted opaque. Heavy, steel bumper modifications have been welded to the chassis. The hood h been chopped back to make room for the super-charged scho bus engine that powers it. And it drives without headlights. LIKE A CAR POSSESSED, reckless and demonic.
Armed guards playing cards at a table. At the service entrance, a guy draws back the peep hole i reenforced steel door just as В—

The door FLIES OFF IT'S HINGES and skids, sparking across parking lot on a chain behind the BAT-MOBILE. The guards rush outside, guns at the ready. The LINCOLN CONTINENTAL does a skidding 180 dragging the heavy door. BAT-MAN accelerates, then stomps the brakes. The heavy ST DOOR flies past him SMASHING into the guards. Meanwhile, attracted by the noise. More armed men rush do the staircase. Enter THE BAT-MAN В—
Two options: Tonight you men can go to prison or to the prison hospital, the choice is yours.
The first goon to recover LEVELS A SHOTGUN. THE BAT-MAN throws a VICIOUS KICK to the guy's CROTCH bef he can fire.
That's the one I HOPED you'd pick.

THE BAT-MAN leaps into the fray Taloned claws sink into a man's shoulder, he screams as h THROWN THROUGH A WINDOW. Another thug swings a bat. THE BAT-MAN kicks him in the chest, grabs his bat from mi air and flings it В—
В— into the face of another gunner across the room. A guy gets the drop on THE BAT-MAN with a machine gun.
There are seven working defenses from this position. Three of them disarm with minimal contact. Three of them kill. The other just HURTS!
He throws a MAIMING SIDE-KICK into a guy's hip.
He's young, Father. He'll probably walk again. But he'll stay SCARED.
THE BAT-MAN puts a foot between another's shoulder blade
Fear clouds their judgement, makes them stiff and clumsy.
Guys keep pouring down the stairs. THE BAT-MAN throws one OVER THE RAIL.  Another goes THROU WINDOW.
They are like rag dolls to me now. To be thrown aside and forgotten.

A third gets CRUSHED UNDERFOOT as THE BAT-MAN continues t climb, floor by floor, to the top. It's been a tough fight. He's sweated through his clothes lost his cape but the action only makes him stronger. A G OF EXCITEMENT shines off him.
There is only one man I am looking for tonight. He's the GENERAL!
And, now, before him ESTRADA tries to muster some composu He's run out of men to fight for him and stands surrounde half-starved Asian women with hate in their eyes.
Ah, ESTRADA. At last we meet face to face. Such as it is. You're coming with me. I have a lot of questions for you.
ESTRADA is backing to the wall in pure fear. THE BAT-MAN' gloved hand covers his eyes. Everything goes DARK.
Close up of a syringe. The tip makes a dimple in ESTRADA's neck.
This is Hydro-strychnine-sulfate, you can think of it as a cross between truth serum and the worst acid trip of your life. Makes the stuff they had a Woodstock feel like aspirin.
THE BAT-MAN presses the sinister syringe into ESTRADA's carotid artery. There's an immediate change in ESTRADA's attitude.
An obviously drugged ESTRADA, duct taped to a 6th floor f pole, rants loudly. A few cops stand around looking up at the spectacle. A crowd has gathered. ESTRADA yells to anyone who will listenВ—

We get the girls from overseas. They work for us. Loeb takes money, he runs the show. The trains run on time. Keeps the show on the road. Police say, you do your job, we do your job. No wait. I do my job you pay me. Something like that.
We go to parties sometimes. I have a nice car.
(to a junior cop) Cut him down before someone hears him.
The cop cuts him down and we cut forward to В—
GORDON rages at a desk sergeant.
This man is a known felon. He's on the MOST WANTED LIST. We have numerous witnesses who heard him confessing to serious racketeering and corruption operations. You can't just let him go!
He walks. I got my orders.
(kicking the desk, hard) Dammit!
DENT pulls GORDON off.        .
Jesus, Jim, calm down. What do you expect, the man was assaulted, drugged, kidnapped. Nothing he says is admissible in court. No sane person will prosecute.
Bull. It was Loeb who sprung him to cover his own butt.
GORDON stomps off in a rage.

THE BAT-MAN sits in his LINCOLN CONTINENTAL across the st from the police station. In the morning light it looks mo like a souped-up limo than a demon car - ALMOST. THE BAT-MAN is totally messed up. His clothes hang in tatters. Blood puddles in the foot-well of the car. He listens to the tapes of ESTRADA's 'confession' В—

(on tape) Loeb runs the whole thing, uses cops as bagmen to collect and distribute the        money. He's into everything, numbers, drugs, girls, guns. You name it, he gets a cut. Hey, you don't look like my mother.

Click. THE BAT-MAN turns off the machine and looks out his tinte window. GORDON storms out of the precinct house. A dazed and rumpled looking ESTRADA (newly released) and FLASS (his releaser) share a smile at GORDON'S obvious fu

The enemy is everywhere, even HERE. These so called policemen nurture the cancer, they breed it in men like ESTRADA and turn it lose on my streets. It looks like ESTRADA is only another soldier. The real generals live in there.
THE BAT-MAN looks up at the GOTHAM JUSTICE BUILDING and s out loud В—
It's your turn Loeb. I'm coming after YOU.
With a painful effort, THE BAT-MAN puts the car in gear.
So I must climb higher still.  Your loving son, Bruce.
The LINCOLN drives off.
LITTLE AL walks down the same crappy sidewalk as before w his coffees and doughnuts.

location: JUNK YARD BEHIND LITTLE AL'S GARAGE

text: LITTLE AL enters a transformed junk yard.  Piles of junk been moved. Rearranged.
Bruce?

All around LITTLE AL sees evidence of TARGET PRACTICE, STRANGE DEVICES and SMALL EXPLOSIONS.  There's the LINCOL CONTINENTAL with BLOOD POOLED ON THE SEAT. He follows BLOOD DROPLETS up the wooden stairs that lead BRUCE's apartment. The door hangs slightly ajar. LITTLE A pushes it open and enters.

BRUCE's apartment has been TRANSFORMED into a crime fight command center. There's a HUGE FLOW chart describing Gotham's crime organizations, people's names, rank, jobs and police involvement. Pictures of LOEB and ESTRADA hang from the wall with duct tape. Crime fighting gear lays piled on the tables (and i that CHI-CHI's paper department store bag of money?). In a series of metal lockers we can see the progression o BRUCE's suits, belts, weapons and disguises. Some broken. Many caked with blood. LITTLE AL finds THE BAT-MAN lying UNCONSCIOUS ON THE FLOO He's lost a lot of blood.
BRUCE comes around in his bed. His eyes flutter and then open. He's momentarily confused. LITTLE AL sits nearby drinking a coffee.
You... didn't call the police?
Nope.
BRUCE looks at his bandages. Not a bad job at all. He tri to sit up. Too painful.

Settle down boy, let me tell you something. I seen a lot of people get cut all to pieces in the jungle. And after, I seen even more come home all cut up on the inside. Now, they trained me to heal a man on the outside with bandages and thread. But there ain't nothing anyone can do for those wounds on the inside. You just stay the hell out of the way and hope they sort it out for themselves. I've been wondering when you were going to go off. But this? This is something else. (beat) You know it's a lucky thing we're the same blood type.
LITTLE AL holds up his arm. He's got a transfusion hose g from it into BRUCE.
If we weren't, I'd have HAD to take you to the hospital. And they would have thrown your ass in Arkham Asylum.

GORDON follows an orderly through the large, time-worn Victorian building. Strange sounds emanate from doors lining the hallways В— WHIMPERING. GIGGLING. SOBBING. A pair of ORDERLIES pass wheeling a young, very pale man straight jacket. He has green-ish hair.
(laughs) You're joking.

GORDON watches them go by before knocking on an office do marked, "Dr. Patricia Holcomb, MD, Ph.D. Director.' INT. PATRICIA HOLCOMB'S OFFICE - AFTERNOON. Patricia Holcomb is a handsome woman reaching early middl age with all the dignity that could be expected of someon who spends their lives surrounded by the criminally insan
Thank you for seeing me doctor.  I'll try not to take up much of your time.
Not at all detective. I've been following your vigilante case with some interest. An intriguing mind.  I look forward to hosting it, if that's possible.
You say that as if you don't think we're going to catch him.
I'm not sure you can, not alive anyway. I've read the files you sent over. They describe a man who inhabits a delusional world of great danger and violence.
Danger and violence. Sounds about right for the East End.
Ah, but this mind inhabits a world more horrible than the East End. A world so threatening and dangerous that it's had to create a new persona, a new IDENTITY to cope.
This guy's become a demon in order to fight his demons.
Exactly. Now, normally this kind of delusion represents the terminal stage of a suicidal psychosis.
He's trying to kill himself?
Yes and no. Something is keeping it going. A quest or a mission of some sort. Much like the crusaders in ancient Europe who were capable of great feats by virtue of their belief or faith.
You mean flying? X-ray vision?
Nothing like that I assure you.  More like mothers lifting cars off children during emergencies. Or even monks and Yogis who's faith allows them to do incredible things with their bodies.
So how do I catch him before his faith does any more "great feats" to the citizens of this city?

I'm afraid that's your problem Detective. My job is knowing what makes them thick, not what makes them run. I will tell you this though, that mind is starting to enjoy its work. It's capable of anything.
Come on doctor, what do I DQ? How do I stop him before he kills someone?
I suppose you strike at the weaknesses. What is this great delusion protecting? It didn't just come into being over night. It started long ago with a young boy being terribly, terribly hurt.
Huh. Interesting. Thank you doctor.
GORDON stands to go.
GORDON, lost in thought, digs for his keys. He's startled JANET SELLING.
Detective Gordon, Detective Gordon.  Wait up a second. JANET SELLING, Channel One News. Can I have a word with you?
Sorry, I'm in a rush here.
It'll only take a second.  I want to ask about allegations of corruption in the precinct. I'm hoping you'll corroborate some of the rumors I've been hearing.
I really AM in a hurry.
A hurry to what, chase a mental case? Doesn't it ANGER you that you've been put out to pasture while all through the department corruption is running rampant.
GORDON SPINS on her, furious. Then catches himself and smiles. SHE GOT HIM.
OK, what do you want to know?
SELLING smiles and takes out a note pad.
THE BAT-MAN climbs up a black iron DRAIN SPOUT in the rai It's DIRTY, SLIPPERY, DANGEROUS work. Gotham City spreads out, glittering and twinkling, far be

head_text.subj: INT GOTHAM JUSTICE BUILDING. LOEB'S OFFICE

text: LOEB sits in a red leather club chair drinking brandy as Mayor NOONE paces the room.
You see Channel One News? They just ran a big police corruption story.  Someone's talking. It's that damn Gordon, I'm telling you.
We're going to have to take drastic measures with that detective. But right now we've got bigger problems. Our friends on the street are making some seriously unhappy noises about this vigilante.
For Christ's sake, Gillian! Things are slipping into chaos. What's going on around here?
I don't know, exactly. For now, our boys on the force are keeping our associates calm. But I'd like to meet face-to-face, let them air their concerns, do a little damage control.
(smiles) Sounds like you're talking about one of your parties.
Yeah, I talked to ESTRADA he'll bring some girls.
All his girls are so В— PRISSY.
Don't worry, I know you like 'em more, umm, assertive. We'll find you a party favor. I'll see to it myself. And by the way, here.
LOEB tosses a yellow envelope like the one FLASS tried to give to GORDON, only fatter, at the mayor.
The precinct guys wanted you to have this.
The mayor flips through it, smiles. We pan out the window to В—

A large gargoyle sits hunched on the granite facade of th justice building. Wrapped in his cape, THE BAT-MAN remains unmoving in the cold, pouring rain. Pigeons walk around on the ledge next him, cooing and pecking at bird excrements and smog fallo A wire runs along the ledge leading to a small contact microphone attached to the window. THE BAT-MAN grins.
(to self) Oh boy, we've been invited to a party.
He reels in his contact mic.
GORDON bursts in, interrupting.  It's becoming a pattern these two.
What's up Jim. You look terrible.

(paces the room) My office was ransacked. They were at my apartment too. Broke the locks, tossed the place. They tried to make it look like burglars but I think it was Flass and his crew looking for my file.
I'm not surprised, after that news story, you're likely to be public enemy number one to those guys. In fact, that file MAY be only thing keeping you alive at this point.
Great, because they FOUND it and they TOOK it.
